intro: Lepidium heterophyllum f. canescens, commonly known as the grayleaf peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its glaucous, silver-gray foliage, which gives it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in racemes, typical of the family. The species is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
